### getStackAddress() {#a84d626ad52140616b26b997d67d2c7b1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Register anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUCallLowering.cpp&#125;::AMDGPUIncomingArgHandler::getStackAddress (uint64&#95;t MemSize, int64&#95;t Offset, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> &amp; MPO, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/isd/argflagsty">ISD::ArgFlagsTy</a> Flags)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Materialize a VReg containing the address of the specified stack-based object.

This is either based on a FrameIndex or direct SP manipulation, depending on the context. <code>MPO</code> should be initialized to an appropriate description of the address created.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpucalllowering-cpp/#l00103">103</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpucalllowering-cpp">AMDGPUCallLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### markPhysRegUsed() {#a43bb78ea0cab740ed24747c893cc797a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;AMDGPUCallLowering.cpp&#125;::AMDGPUIncomingArgHandler::markPhysRegUsed (unsigned PhysReg)</>}>
How the physical register gets marked varies between formal parameters (it&#39;s a basic-block live-in), and a call instruction (it&#39;s an implicit-def of the BL).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpucalllowering-cpp/#l00153">153</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/amdgpucalllowering-cpp">AMDGPUCallLowering.cpp</a>.
